text: Austerlitz may refer to: == People == * Austerlitz (family) * Fred Astaire, born Frederick Austerlitz * Robert Austerlitz (1923–1994), linguist, specialist in the Proto-Finno-Ugric language == History == * Battle of Austerlitz, an 1805 victory by the French Grand Army of Napoleon Bonaparte == Places == * Another name for Slavkov u Brna, Czech Republic, giving its name to the Battle of Austerlitz * Gare d'Austerlitz, railway station of Paris, France * Austerlitz, Netherlands * Austerlitz (Oscar, Louisiana), a plantation house listed on the NRHP in Louisiana, US * Austerlitz, New York, United States * Austerlitz, Kentucky, United States == Culture == * Austerlitz (1960 film) directed by Abel Gance * Austerlitz (2016 film), a documentary film * Austerlitz (novel) by W. G. Sebald, 2001 * "Austerlitz", a song by The Jezabels on the album Prisoner, 2011 * Austerlitz (video game), a turn-based strategy video game
title: Austerlitz
